intro: Bidens robertianifolia, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are erect and branching. Bidens robertianifolia produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
